headline: Closing Bell Movers: Snap falls 14% after Q1 results, no guidance
summary: In the opening 90 minutes of the evening session, U.S. equity futures are softer – Dow Industrials are flat, but S&P 500 is off by 0.2% and Nasdaq 100 is down 0.4%. In energy, WTI crude oil is extending Tuesday’s decline toward the $60 per barrel level after the largest build in API crude stocks data in four weeks. In metals, Gold is slightly lower below $3,330 per ounce. A busy afterhours earnings session saw a mixed picture in the Semiconductors and Tech space. Seagate jumped 9% on earnings be

headline: FSLR Q1 Earnings Call: Tariffs and Policy Uncertainty Drive Down Guidance, Margins Under Pressure
summary: Solar panel manufacturer First Solar (NASDAQ:FSLR) met Wall Street’s revenue expectations in Q1 CY2025, with sales up 6.4% year on year to $844.6 million. On the other hand, the company’s full-year revenue guidance of $5 billion at the midpoint came in 8.7% below analysts’ estimates. Its GAAP profit of $1.95 per share was 22.1% below analysts’ consensus estimates.

headline: First Solar (NasdaqGS:FSLR) Lowers 2025 Guidance, Reports US$845 Million Q1 Sales
summary: Despite announcing mixed earnings results for Q1 2025, First Solar (NasdaqGS:FSLR) experienced a 7.79% increase in its share price over the last month. The company reported increased sales but a decline in net income and earnings per share, and it adjusted its full-year guidance to reflect a more conservative outlook. During this period, broader market indices such as the S&P 500 and Nasdaq saw decreases amid weaker GDP data and cautious outlooks from major tech companies, suggesting that...

headline: First Solar Signals Possible Wave of Write-Downs Driven by Trade War
summary: First Solar shares are getting hammered after the company reported disappointing results and trimmed its earnings and revenue guidance.  A less-prominent disclosure in its new quarterly report could portend a new phase of losses ahead at companies with large manufacturing plants overseas.  In a footnote, the solar-panel maker said it may have to take big write-downs on the value of its property, plant and equipment (PP&E).

raw.headline: First Solar Signals Possible Wave of Write-Downs Driven by Trade War

headline: First Solar, Yum Brands, Volkswagen: Trending Tickers
summary: Catalysts host Madison Mills and Freedom Capital Markets chief global strategist Jay Woods examine some of today's trending tickers. First Solar (FSLR) shares fall after the solar power company lowered its 2025 outlook, saying that President Trump's tariffs present a "significant economic headwind." Yum! Brands (YUM) releases mixed first quarter results with Pizza Hut sales missing estimates as Taco Bell held strong. Volkswagen (VWAGY) reports a 37% drop in profit in the first quarter, adding that Trump's tariffs may further hurt earnings. To watch more expert insights and analysis on the latest market action, check out more Catalysts here.
